required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of a Group B Streptococcus Vaccine in Healthy Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib Randomized, Observer-Blind, Controlled, Single Center, Dose-Ranging Study of a Group B Streptococcus Vaccine in Healthy Women 18-40 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of a Group B Streptococcus vaccine.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of study subjects in each study group that meets or exceeds specified GBS serotype-specific antibody levels (determined by ELISA) one month and one year after the last injection
The GMC and GMR (and associated 95% CI) for GBS serotype-specific antibody responses one month and one year after last injection for each study group

secondary_outcome.measure: Solicited local and systemic reactions, AEs, and SAEs

arm_group.description: high and low dose versus presence or absence of adjuvant
two different doses of alternate adjuvant
a single active vaccine injection vs two active vaccine injections

intervention.description: The study will include two enrollment groups (340 subjects each). Each enrollment group will evaluate a high and low dose versus the presence or absence of adjuvant
Each enrollment group will evaluate a high and low dose versus dose of adjuvant
Half of all vaccine recipients will receive a single active vaccine injection and half will receive two identical active vaccine injections (1 month apart)
A placebo group who receive saline will be included in each enrollment group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy females 18-40 years of age inclusive.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals who are pregnant or nursing.
- Individuals who have had a previous immunization with a vaccine containing streptococcus antigens or any vaccine within 30 days of enrollment through 30 days of study completion.
- Individuals with a history of severe allergic reactions after previous vaccination
- Individuals with designated blood tests that are not within normal range
